- Prewires, OpsDB entries, Unboxing gear, Unloading trucks, IMS Inventory cycle counts, IMS Inventory transactions. Experience Data Center Operations Associate / Factory Build Engineer Yahoo March 2014  – Present (1 year 6 months) Buffalo/Niagara, New York Area Responsibilities: 
Installation of new equipment in the data center. 
Build engineer for Yahoo, Inc. – Keeping up with current processes and procedures for new and old technology.  
Running fiber optic cable to connect installs to the network for use by all of Yahoo, Inc.’s various properties. 
Shipping and Receiving equipment in loading dock – forklift trained, bad shipments and corrective actions requests, removing new equipment from shipped crates safely and securing it in the data center. Receiving equipment virtually by scanning and attaching Yahoo, Inc. serial numbers. 
Cycle Counting warehouse inventory and solving variances. 
Virtual Inventory transactions in a Oracle Inventory Management System 
Duties: 
Prioritize day-to-day workloads to meet long-term expectations. 
Analyze work orders and solve discrepancies. 
Meeting work order hand off dates and service level agreements. 
Working long hours for high priority, revenue sensitive builds. Customer Care Agent III/ Case Manager Yahoo September 2013  –  March 2014  (7 months) Buffalo/Niagara, New York Area Responsibilities: 
Provide world-class service to all Yahoo! Customers in a customer centric environment.  
Successfully resolve complex customer e-mail and telephone inquiries through the use of multiple customer support tools. 
Assisting customers with inquiries while providing consultative support and recommendations. 
Document in detail all interactions with customers. 
Effectively articulate complex information to a variety of technical and non-technical customers. 
Educate customers on products and help customers to be successful. 
Identify and evaluate opportunities to increase customer retention and satisfaction through the use of up/cross selling products and services. 
Duties: 
Successfully perform against department scorecard metrics including Quality Assurance, Average Handle Time, and Customer Satisfaction Rating. Claims Service Representative I GEICO November 2007  –  February 2009  (1 year 4 months) Buffalo/Niagara, New York Area Responsibilities: 
Answer calls from policy holders on new claims and enter them into a management information system.  
Answer calls from policy holders on existing claims. 
Make decisions on claims based on policy information, accident description, third party information, and the policy holder’s contract. 
Advise the policy holder, or the policy holder’s power of attorney and the victim or claimant about the next step in the claims process. 
Duties: 
Inbound and outbound calls to policy holders. 
Remain professional and courteous at all times. 
Work within boundaries set forth by the insurance industry, local, state and federal laws.  
Handle calls from policy holders and claimants in very stressful situations which may include death of a loved one, the shock of being involved in an accident, or injuries.
